keyword: calories in a two egg omelet
title: Calories in a Two Egg Omelet
meta_description: Learn calories in a two egg omelet, with full nutrition facts including protein, fat, carbs, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: Calories in a Two Egg Omelet
assumptions: Two large eggs (~50 g each), plain omelet cooked with 1 tsp butter; no fillings, salt, or additional ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, brand, cooking method, added fats, and fillings. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A two-egg omelet has about 180 kcal and 13 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a two egg omelet?
faqs.a: About 180 kcal for a plain version with minimal butter.

faqs.q: How much protein is in a two egg omelet?
Does the cooking fat affect calories in a two egg omelet?
faqs.a: Yes, using butter or oil adds ~36 kcal; nonstick cooking keeps it lower.

faqs.q: What about a veggie two egg omelet calories?
faqs.a: Around 190 kcal with low-calorie additions like onions or peppers.

faqs.q: Is cholesterol high in a two egg omelet?
faqs.a: Yes, two eggs contribute 372 mg, mainly from the yolks.
